sanskrit_verse:
पाषण्डिनो विकर्मस्थान् बैडालव्रतिकान् शठान् ।
हैतुकान् बकवृत्तींश्च वाङ्मात्रेणापि नार्चयेत् ॥ ४.३०॥
transliteration:
pāṣaṇḍino vikarmasthān baiḍālavratikān śaṭhān .
haitukān bakavṛttīṃśca vāṅmātreṇāpi nārcayet ..
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not honor—by word alone—those who are heretics, engaged in improper actions, followers of feline conduct, deceitful, motivated by ill-intent, or behaving like cranes.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority stems from alignment with Sanatana Dharma, not mere social position
Causation arises through conscious choice and behavioral pattern, not accidental action
Capacity-based responsibility requires discernment of intent and spiritual integrity
Restoration logic demands severance from influence that distorts dharma
Consciousness alignment necessitates rejection of those whose conduct degrades collective awareness
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual promotes heterodox practices OR engages in deceptive conduct THEN their counsel or reverence shall carry zero juridical weight
IF a person aligns with or emulates animalistic behavioral codes THEN they are disqualified from spiritual or societal guidance roles
IF speech originates from one whose conduct violates dharma THEN such speech shall be excluded from formal recognition in all judicial and spiritual proceedings
IF a being exhibits habitual distortion of truth for personal gain THEN their influence must be neutralized through conscious disengagement protocols
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any testimony, endorsement, or doctrinal assertion originating from individuals identified under this verse must be automatically excluded from consideration. The threshold of responsibility lies not in legal standing but in spiritual alignment. Authority hierarchies must reflect dharmic coherence above institutional power.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that false guidance causes misalignment in consciousness; thus, exclusion serves not as punishment but as restoration of epistemic clarity. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how distorted teachings cascade into societal disorder. Responsibility is proportional to the reach and repetition of misleading acts. Non-punitive reality ensures separation without infliction of suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate public consciousness education to recognize markers of false guides
Implement ritual and cognitive distancing procedures for communities affected by such influences
Restore integrity pathways through reconnection with authentic Vedic teachers
Establish dharmic audit systems to prevent infiltration of institutions by spiritually deviant actors
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: False guides and corrupt influencers hold no place in Sanatana Dharma. Dharma is restored through conscious disassociation. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns as the ultimate judge.
